flawed_nl_solution:
If it was 10 degrees hotter on this day in Miami than in New York, then the temperature in Miami was 80+10 = 120 degrees.
If it was 25 degrees cooler in Miami than in San Diego, then the temperature in San Diego was 120+25 = <<120+25=145>>145 degrees.
The total temperature for all the cities is 145+120+80 = <<145+120+80=345>>345 degrees
The average temperature of the three cities is 345/3 = <<345/3=115>>115 degrees
#### 115

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 90, not 120. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
